alert.note: Alert for Smyth (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 28 at 8:09PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following county, Smyth. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 807 PM EDT, Flash flooding that occurred is receding slowly, and is confined to only a few areas. Since rain has ended, the flash flood warning is being replaced by a flood warning. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Middle Fork Holston River, Turkey Run Creek, Beaver Creek, Laurel Creek, Robertson Branch, Tattle Branch, Crewey Branch, Little Tumbling Creek and North Fork Holston River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Saltville, Quarry, Broadford and Allison Gap. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
